I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to analyze and articulate visions of human flourishing. We read primary sources and responded to guest speakers from the traditions of Utilitarianism, Judaism, Expressive Individualism, Christianity, Nietzscheanism, Buddhism, and Islam. We also wrote short papers on Yales vision, our peers vision, and our own vision of a life worth living.
I constructed my own vision of what makes a life worth living.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)

Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)

Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely. This class is one of the best classes Ive taken at Yale. Even though we only scratched the surfaces of the various traditions we looked at, I still feel like I can more clearly see the ideologies we swim in every day. Articulating my vision of a life worth living was an incredibly orienting experience, and perhaps one of the most important things Im taking away from my time at Yale.
Yes, absolutely; must take; most introspective period of my college career

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
